snippet: After a car bombing on Monday continued a wave of attacks, President Ashraf Ghani accused Pakistan of failing to prevent fighters from gatherings in its territory.
abstract: Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani blames Pakistan for ignoring fact that Taliban fighters gather in its territory to plan attacks like deadly Kabul bombings that have claimed 70 lives over four days; atypically combative statement suggests Pakistan-brokered talks between Afghan government and Taliban are dead for moment.

byline.contributor: Fazal Muzhary and Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: After a car bombing on Monday continued a wave of attacks, President Ashraf Ghani accused Pakistan of failing to prevent fighters from gatherings in its territory.

headline.main: After Kabul Attack, Afghan Leader Points Finger at Pakistan for Failing to Stop Taliban
headline.print_headline: Afghans Accuse Pakistan of Complicity in Attacks
